name: Valley popcorn flower, Grey popcorn flower
overview: It is an annual herb that is found in the Mojave and Sonoran deserts throughout California, Arizona and northern Baja. A flowering plant under the borage family, this wildflower has a purple edge and has purple juice when the leaves are crushed. The fruit grown is very small and rounded. Blooms from March to May and is endangered.
habitat: Habitats include sandy, gravelly desert areas, especially near Creosote Bush, below 4,000 feet. Endemic to California, the valley popcorn flower is commonly found throughout the central valley down to the southernmost part of California. It can be found in valleys, foothills of the Sierra Nevada, coastlines, and vernal pools.
